name: Carbon Footprint API
description: A universal API to find carbon footprint of almost anything.

folders.name: Emissions
folders.description: This route enables you to find GHG emissions for things that can be directly related to emissions

folders.name: Transport
folders.description: These routes enables you to find GHG emissions for different modes of transports.

data.description: Required: The type of the vehicle.
Required: Origin of the journey.
Required: Destination of the journey.
The number of passengers traveling in the journey. The default sets to 1.

requests.name: Trains
requests.description: This route enables you to find GHG emissions for a number of train types for a certain route.

headers.name: access-control-allow-headers
headers.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

headers.name: access-control-allow-origin
headers.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

headers.name: cf-ray
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: content-encoding
headers.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

headers.name: content-type
headers.description: The mime type of this content

headers.name: date
headers.description: The date and time that the message was sent

headers.name: etag
headers.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

headers.name: expect-ct
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: server
headers.description: A name for the server

headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: x-powered-by
headers.description: Specifies the technology (ASP.NET, PHP, JBoss, e.g.) supporting the web application (version details are often in X-Runtime, X-Version, or X-AspNet-Version)

headers.name: x-ratelimit-limit
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: x-ratelimit-remaining
headers.description: Custom header

data.description: Required: Flight origin airport IATA code.
Required: Flight destination airport IATA code.
Flight type (international or domestic). Default is international.
Flight model
Pass the number of passengers to get the emissions relative to per person on the flight.

requests.name: Flights
requests.description:
Emissions for a flight between two airports.
Only IATA Airport Codes are supported.

data.description: Required: The fuel type used by the vehicle.
Required: Origin of the journey.

The fuel efficiency of the vehicle i.e. distance traveled per unit of fuel. The default value is 20.
The unit of mileage. The default sets to be 'km/L'

data.description: Required: The appliance name.
Required: The type of the appliance. Its necessary if it exists.
Required: Region in which the appliance is used.
The number of appliances being used.
The number of hours the appliances are being used.

requests.name: Appliances
requests.description: This route enables you to find GHG emissions for a number of appliance types for a specific quantity and running time. The emissions are calculated from the electricity based emissions on a particular region.

data.description: Required: The type of the poultry meat(and egg)
Region in which the poultry meat(and egg) is produced. By default we use average of all regions.
The weight(number in case of egg) of poultry meat in production.

requests.name: Poultry
requests.description: This route enables you to find GHG emissions for different type of Poutry meat production. In this we consider the factors like Production emission, Water loss factor, Moisture loss factor, Post-farmgate emissions in different conditions according to region in which they are found.

requests.name: Electricity
requests.description: The emission route can be requested to find emission for any country for per kilowatt of electricity consumed. It can also deliver components of emission like generation and transmission & dissipation when queried with item names generation and td respectively. The region that is unavailable results in returning the emission for the Default region which is calculated as a average of the whole data.
